paper_abstract: In this article, we propose to use the weighted expected sample size (WESS) to evaluate the overall performance of sequential test plans on a finite set S of parameters. Motivated by minimizing the WESS to control the expected sample sizes, we develop the method of double sequential mixture likelihood ratio test (2-SMLRT) for one-sided composite hypotheses. It is proved that the 2-SMLRT is asymptotically optimal on S and its stopping time is finite under some conditions. The 2-SMLRT is general and includes the sequential probability ratio test (SPRT) and the double sequential probability ratio test (2-SPRT) as special cases. Simulation studies show that compared with the SPRT and 2-SPRT, the 2-SMLRT has smaller WESS and relative mean index with less or comparable expected sample sizes when the null hypothesis or alternative hypothesis holds.
paper_title: Asymptotic optimality of double sequential mixture likelihood ratio test
